H0.text: Diffract and spread out is what the light does when a beam of light passes through a clear, convex lens, with the light mostly diffracting and spreading out.

H1.text: Diffraction and convergence to a focal point occur when a beam of light passes through a clear, convex lens.

H2.text: Refract and come to a focal point is what a beam of light mostly does when it passes through a clear, convex lens.

H3.text: Refract and spread out is what a beam of light will do when it passes through a clear, convex lens.

A5.text: Reflections and Refractions in Ray Tracing, a simple but thorough discussion of the mathematics behind refraction and reflection.
